titles.title: Keep America Competitive Tax Credit Act of 2006

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit to employers for employee catastrophic health care costs and to health insurance companies for insurer catastrophic health care costs, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 4/6/2006--Introduced. Keep America Competitive Tax Credit Act of 2006 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow certain employers and health insurance issuers a tax credit for up to 50% of employee catastrophic health care costs (i.e., costs exceeding $50,000 per employee).
